details.description: Most tenants have the right to renew a lease - exceptions and landlord's rights to refuse a renewal of a lease
details.alternative_title: Do you have the right to renew your commercial property lease?
details.body:
Most tenants have the right to renew their business lease when it ends.

However, there are certain tenants who don’t have this right.

Business tenancies without renewal rights

You don’t have automatic renewal rights if you’re:

  • a farm business tenant
  • a mining tenant
  • a service tenant employed by the landlord
  • on fixed-term tenancy of six months or less
  • to waive your right to renew at the start of your lease

The landlordâ€™s right to refuse

Your landlord can refuse to renew your lease if:

  • you’re in breach of your obligations (eg you’ve not paid your rent)
  • they want to use the premises themselves, for their business, or to live there
